item.title: 印尼延长利率暂停期以在美联储决议前支撑印尼盾
item.description: 印尼央行一如预期维持借贷成本不变，政策制定者仍将重点放在保护印尼盾免受美国利率前景带来的影响。【原文：Indonesia’s central bank left borrowing costs unchanged as expected, with policymakers staying focused on shielding the rupiah from vulnerabilities emanating from the US rate outlook.】

item.title: 印度航空首席执行官表示，印度航空业的蓬勃发展可支持更多枢纽的建立
item.description: 印度航空有限公司首席执行官坎贝尔-威尔逊（Campbell Wilson）说，印度航空业发展迅速，除孟买和德里外，印度至少还能支持另一个国际枢纽。【原文：India’s airline industry is growing so fast that the country could support at least one other international hub beyond Mumbai and Delhi, Campbell Wilson, the chief executive officer of Air India Ltd., said.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国市场现在的动向
item.description: 伦敦白教堂市场上的果蔬摊。摄影师：Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg【原文：A fruit and vegetable stall on Whitechapel market in London. Photographer: Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg】

item.title: 中国央行任命两位学者为新政策顾问
item.description: 中国央行已任命两位著名经济学家为货币政策委员会成员，该委员会负责就政策决策提供建议。【原文：China’s central bank has named two prominent economists as members of its monetary policy committee, which advises on policy decisions.】

item.title: K-pop 明星将与大谷一起参加 MLB 首尔运动会，展示韩国风采
item.description: 大谷翔平不会是本周三在首尔高尺巨蛋（Gocheok Sky Dome）的唯一贵宾，K-pop 偶像、知名运动员和政府官员都将在美国职业棒球大联盟新赛季揭幕战上向世界展示韩国。【原文：Shohei Ohtani won’t be the only VIP present at Seoul’s Gocheok Sky Dome on Wednesday as K-pop idols, celebrity athletes and government officials join the opportunity to showcase South Korea to the world at the Major League Baseball season opener.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 欧洲央行计划向投资者介绍关键工资指标
item.description: 欧洲中央银行正计划例行公布官员们在考虑何时降息时用来衡量通胀风险的内部薪酬标准。【原文：The European Central Bank is planning to routinely publish internal pay measures being used by officials to gauge inflation risks as they consider when to cut interest rates.】

item.title: 印度最大的电池千兆工厂将于十月投产
item.description: 印度最大的千兆电池工厂将于 10 月份开始运营，据其所有者、电池制造商 Good Enough Energy 称，该工厂计划到 2026 年将产能提高近三倍。【原文：India’s largest gigafactory for batteries will start operating in October, and plans to almost triple its capacity by 2026, according to its owner, battery-maker Good Enough Energy.】

item.title: 中央银行行长称，加入欧盟的漫长等待意味着北马其顿投资者的减少
item.description: 北马其顿央行行长表示，加入欧盟的谈判缺乏进展正在驱赶投资者。【原文：North Macedonia’s central bank governor said the lack of progress in talks to join the European Union is driving away investors.】

item.title: 美联储 "春之祭 "绽放通胀担忧之花
item.description:
经济过热现在被视为比经济衰退更大的风险，这是对降息的又一次打击。【原文：

Overheating in the economy is now seen as a bigger risk than recession in yet one more strike against rate cuts. 

】

item.title: 瑞士宝盛重启业务，摆脱瑞士银行业新困境
item.description:
在经历了一系列失误之后，这家私人银行的管理层承诺控制风险。【原文：

After a series of missteps, the private bank’s management is pledging to rein in risk.

】

item.title: 如果你是人工智能牛人，请关注铀矿
item.description:
未来取决于我们是否有能力生产更多的电力。【原文：

The future depends on our ability to generate a lot more electricity.

】

item.title: 瑞典陷入困境的住宅建筑业出现生机
item.description: 在利率飙升和房价暴跌导致房屋建筑业萎缩之后，瑞典的房屋建筑业正显示出初步复苏的迹象。【原文：Sweden’s home construction sector is showing tentative signs of recovery after shrinking as interest rates surged and housing prices plunged.】

item.title: 非洲顶级交易所将在两个月内进行碳抵消交易
item.description: 运营非洲最大股票和债券交易所的 JSE 有限公司将在两个月内开始碳抵消交易。【原文：JSE Ltd., which operates Africa’s biggest stock and bond exchanges, will start trading carbon offsets within two months.】

item.title: 瑞士降息曲线球不容忽视，银行转而反对法郎
item.description: 一些银行预计，瑞士决策者将在今年的首次决策中一反常态，下调利率。【原文：A handful of banks expect Switzerland’s policymakers will go against forecasts and cut interest rates in their first decision of the year.】

item.title: 农民抗议，欧盟同意扩大对乌克兰的贸易优惠
item.description: 欧盟更接近于将对乌克兰的贸易支持再延长一年，同时制定更强有力的保障措施，以防止某些产品的进口量过高。【原文：The European Union got closer to extending trade support for Ukraine for another year, while creating stronger safeguards to prevent imports of certain products getting too high.】

item.title: 摩根大通认为大选后外国投资者涌入印度股市
item.description: 大选结束后，印度股市有望吸引更多的外资流入，印度经济增长前景看好，美联储降息也起到了催化剂的作用。【原文：Indian equities are poised to lure more foreign inflows after the general elections, with the economy’s promising growth prospects and the Federal Reserve’s rate cuts acting as catalysts.】

item.title: 中国房地产危机推动私人信贷流向科技行业
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）私人信贷亚洲区主管胡波（Bo Hu）表示，私人信贷投资者在中国的投资机会正从房地产市场转向包括绿色企业在内的科技行业。【原文：Private credit investors’ opportunities in China are shifting from the property market to technology sectors, including green businesses, according to Bo Hu, head of private credit Asia at HSBC Holdings Plc.】

item.title: 中国 550 亿美元贷款激增指向 "国家队 "救援
item.description: 中国 2 月份对非银行金融机构的贷款激增，创下七年来之最，这引发了一种猜测，即贷款机构向国有基金提供了大量资金，因为它们购买股票以帮助阻止数万亿美元的市场崩溃。【原文：China’s loans to non-bank financial institutions surged in February by the most in seven years, prompting speculation that lenders provided a big boost of capital to state funds as they bought shares to help stem a multi-trillion dollar market rout.】

item.title: 比特币震荡，交易员等待美联储关于降息范围的指引
item.description: 比特币徘徊在约两周以来的最低水平附近，原因是专用交易所交易基金的资金流入趋缓，以及对美国降息空间正在缩小的担忧。【原文：Bitcoin hovered near the lowest level in about two weeks, sapped by moderating inflows into dedicated exchange-traded funds as well as concerns that the scope for US interest-rate cuts is diminishing.】

item.title: 马来西亚央行警惕林吉特走势不稳
item.description: 马来西亚央行告诫说，在对全球货币政策的预期起伏不定的情况下，林吉特的前景可能仍然不平衡，并承诺要保持对这一仍然是亚洲表现最差货币之一的货币的信心。【原文：Malaysia’s central bank cautioned that the ringgit’s outlook may remain uneven amid fluctuating expectations on global monetary policy, and pledged to preserve confidence in the currency that remains one of Asia’s worst-performers.】

item.title: 反对党计划提出修正案，澳大利亚央行改革受阻
item.description: 澳大利亚政府和反对党在储备银行新的货币政策委员会的组成问题上僵持不下，这一摊牌有可能破坏彻底改革该机构所需的立法。【原文：Australia’s government and the opposition are at loggerheads over the makeup of the Reserve Bank’s new monetary policy committee, a showdown that threatens to derail legislation needed to overhaul the institution.】

item.title: 马来西亚称高盛诉讼是审查 1MDB 交易的机会
item.description: 马来西亚称，高盛集团在涉及数十亿美元的 1MDB 丑闻的分歧不断发酵的情况下提起诉讼，使该国有机会重新审视此前与该银行达成的有争议的和解协议。【原文：Malaysia said a lawsuit Goldman Sachs Group Inc. initiated amid festering disagreement involving the multibillion-dollar 1MDB scandal gives the country a chance to review a contentious settlement it had previously struck with the bank.】

item.title: 中国中化集团从加拿大输油管道输送首批石油
item.description: 中国中化集团（Sinochem Group）购买了通过加拿大一条新管道运输的首批原油货物之一，该管道旨在将石油从内陆的阿尔伯塔省运往太平洋沿岸出口。【原文：China’s Sinochem Group has purchased one of the first crude cargoes shipped through a new pipeline in Canada, which is designed to move oil from landlocked Alberta to the Pacific Coast for export.】

item.title: 央行同步降息，美元押注面临风险
item.description: 各国央行可能将开始自 2008 年以来最同步的降息行动，这似乎将支持美元的新生反弹。【原文：The likelihood that central banks are about to embark upon the most synchronized reduction of interest rates since 2008 looks set to support the dollar in its nascent rebound.】

item.title: 投资 60 亿美元建设化肥厂，帮助印尼降低食品成本
item.description: 印度尼西亚国有企业 PT Pupuk Indonesia 将投资 60 多亿美元增加化肥供应，以降低食品成本。【原文：Indonesia’s state-owned PT Pupuk Indonesia will invest more than $6 billion to boost fertilizer supply as part of a bid to temper food costs.】

item.title: 随着需求增长，印度准备启动新的液化天然气进口终端
item.description: 印度正寻求为其最新的液化天然气终端购买首批货物，因为该国的目标是在本十年内迅速增加这种燃料的消费量。【原文：India is looking to purchase the inaugural shipment for its latest liquefied natural gas terminal, as the nation aims to rapidly increase consumption of the fuel this decade.】

item.title: 中国人民银行不放松政策，中国银行保持贷款利率不变
item.description: 继中国央行最近决定维持货币政策不变之后，中国各银行周三维持了基准贷款利率不变。【原文：Chinese banks maintained their benchmark lending rates on Wednesday, following the central bank’s recent decision to stand pat on monetary policy.】

item.title: 门罗将开设阿布扎比办事处，为推进中东业务招聘员工
item.description: 据一位熟知内情的人士透露，私人信用贷款公司 Monroe Capital 正在敲定在阿布扎比设立办事处的计划，以拓展中东市场。【原文：Private credit lender Monroe Capital is finalizing plans to establish an office in Abu Dhabi in an effort to expand into the Middle East, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 人工智能基础设施公司 Astera Labs 首次公开募股定价高于目标价，将融资 7.13 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Astera Labs 公司及其投资者将筹集约 7.13 亿美元，这家半导体连接公司首次公开发行股票的定价高于市场预期范围。【原文：Astera Labs Inc. and its investors are set to raise about $713 million, pricing shares in the semiconductor connectivity company’s initial public offering above the marketed range, according to people familiar with the matter.】
